Name: indium rich leaching residues, from zinc production stockpiling | indium rich leaching residues, from zinc production stockpiling | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals
Description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11564/documentation

;Stockpiling is a way of assuring provision and control over supplies, and is systematically applied with some commodities by several countries.;The United States has a known and well documented national stockpiling service. Indium can be found as one of the commodities that is stockpiled, as it is considered of strategic importance.;This dataset describes the stockpiling of  indium rich leaching residues following zinc production. The stockpiling is considered to happen in the geographical sourroundings of the zinc production site.;Sources:;-US Department of defense, 2013, Strategic and Critical Materials - Report on Stockpile Requirements.;-Reconfiguration of the National Defense Stockpile Report to Congress, April 2009.

Activity starts with the arrival of indium rich leaching residues to the stockpile

The activity ends with the provision of the service of stockpiling the indium rich leaching residues.
